name: Morondanga Republik: Dead Queen
description:
Legend has it that in the year 1567, Queen Verena was found strangled to death by her own boa constrictor in her chambers on a hot spring night.
She was found dead by her son Filomenus when he was only 6 years old. The Boa was never found. Her name was Muriel.
As no one had ever succeeded in portraying Queen Verena, eventually the entire population, even her own son, began to forget her face.
When Filomenus turned 15 years old, he asked for his mother to be exhumed and for Sandra Mort, a renowned artist of the region, to paint her. Sandra Mort brought her own boa to pose. Her name was Lorna.
The result was the painting "THE DEAD QUEEN", cultural patrimony of Morondanga Republik, valued at more than 477 billion tezos.

Flora Márquez - 2021
